speaker: Programmer
text: Anyone there?

speaker: Apiza
text: Hi!

speaker: Apiza
text: I am Apiza, a virtual assistant built to help you navigate the Allegro API.

speaker: Apiza
text: How can I help you?

speaker: Programmer
text: What functions are provided for keyboard input?

speaker: Apiza
text: I found the following functions labelled as "Keyboard routines":\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
al_install_keyboard
al_is_keyboard_installed
al_uninstall_keyboard
al_get_keyboard_state
al_clear_keyboard_state
al_key_down
al_keycode_to_name
al_set_keyboard_leds
al_get_keyboard_event_source

speaker: Programmer
text: what is the parameter list of ai_install_keyboard

speaker: Apiza
text: bool al_install_keyboard(void)

speaker: Programmer
text: When does ai_install_keyboard return true?

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true if successful. If a driver was already installed, nothing happens and true is returned.

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the parameter list of al_uninstall_keyboard

speaker: Apiza
text: void al_uninstall_keyboard(void)

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I implement keyboard input?

speaker: Apiza
text: To get keyboard input, you can utilize the ALLEGRO_EVENT struct.

speaker: Apiza
text: The event types ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_DOWN, ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_UP, and ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_CHAR allow you to get keys pressed or released in event.keyboard.keycode

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the parameter list for al_get_keyboard_event_source?

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_EVENT_SOURCE *al_get_keyboard_event_source(void)

speaker: Programmer
text: What type is event.keyboard.keycode

speaker: Apiza
text: keyboard.keycode (int)\nThe code corresponding to the physical key which was pressed.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I play sound effects?

speaker: Apiza
text: The simplest method to Play Sound is al_play_sample:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```bool al_play_sample(ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *spl, float gain, float pan, float speed,
 ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE loop, ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID *ret_id)```

speaker: Apiza
text: To use al_play_sample, you must first install the audio subsystem, the audio codec addon, reserve samples, and load sample

speaker: Programmer
text: How do I install the audio subsystem?

speaker: Apiza
text: This should install the audio subsystem:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_install_audio(void)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Install the audio subsystem.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I install an audio codec addon?

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_init_acodec_addon(void)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: This function registers all the known audio file type handlers for al_load_sample, al_save_sample, al_load_audio_stream, etc.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I reserve and load audio samples?

speaker: Apiza
text:
*Reserve audio samples:

```bool al_reserve_samples(int reserve_samples)```

speaker: Apiza
text: Reserves a number of sample instances, attaching them to the default mixer.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
*Load audio samples:

```ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *al_load_sample(const char *filename)```

speaker: Apiza
text: Loads a few different audio file formats based on their extension.

speaker: Programmer
text: Where are the samples allocated?

speaker: Apiza
text: Audio samples are contained within the ALLEGRO_SAMPLE struct.

speaker: Apiza
text: plauy

speaker: Programmer
text: Is this created by al_reserve_samples?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_reserve_samples Returns true on success, false on error.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: al_load_sample Returns the sample on success, NULL on failure.

speaker: Programmer
text: is there a function to free samples?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_destroy_sample should work:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```void al_destroy_sample(ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *spl)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Free the sample data structure.

speaker: Programmer
text: What are possible values for ALLEGRO_PLAYNODE?

speaker: Apiza
text: enum ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Description: Sample and stream playback mode.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
Values:
ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_ONCE
ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_LOOP
ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_BIDIR

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the purpose of the last parameter in al_play_sample? (ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID *ret_id)

speaker: Apiza
text: ret_id - if non-NULL the variable which this points to will be assigned an id representing the sample being played. If al_play_sample returns false, then the contents of ret_id are invalid and must not be used as argument to other functions.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I display text within the window frame?

speaker: Apiza
text: The simplest method to Display text in window frame is al_draw_text:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```void al_draw_text(const ALLEGRO_FONT *font,
 ALLEGRO_COLOR color, float x, float y, int flags,
 char const *text) ```

speaker: Apiza
text: This requires the ALLEGRO_FONT add-on.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I initialize the ALLEGRO_FONT add-on?

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_init_font_addon(void)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Initialise the font addon.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I load a font?

speaker: Apiza
text: The simplest method to Load a font is al_load_font:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```ALLEGRO_FONT *al_load_font(char const *filename, int size, int flags)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Loads a font from disk.

speaker: Programmer
text: What are the parameters size and flags?

speaker: Apiza
text: The size parameter is an int.\n\nThe flags parameter is passed through to either of those functions. Bitmap and TTF fonts are also affected by the current bitmap flags at the time the font is loaded.

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the size of a font?

speaker: Programmer
text: What are possible values for flags?

speaker: Apiza
text: I found a description of the int size for the similar method al_load_ttf_font:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: The size parameter determines the size the font will be rendered at, specified in pixels.

speaker: Apiza
text: I found this list of supported values for the int flags:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
ALLEGRO_TTF_NO_KERNING - Do not use any kerning even if the font file supports it.

ALLEGRO_TTF_MONOCHROME - Load as a monochrome font (which means no anti-aliasing of the font is done).

ALLEGRO_TTF_NO_AUTOHINT - Disable the Auto Hinter which is enabled by default in newer versions of FreeType. Since: 5.0.6, 5.1.2

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I free a font?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_destroy_font\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```void al_destroy_font(ALLEGRO_FONT *f)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Frees the memory being used by a font structure. Does nothing if passed NULL.

speaker: Programmer
text: What are the values x and y in al_draw_text?

speaker: Programmer
text: What are possible values for ALLEGRO_COLOR?

speaker: Apiza
text: The x and y variables are floats.

speaker: Apiza
text: The function al_draw_text Writes the NUL-terminated string text onto the target bitmap at position x, y, using the specified font.

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the coordinate system for x and y?

speaker: Apiza
text: ```typedef struct ALLEGRO_COLOR ALLEGRO_COLOR;```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: An ALLEGRO_COLOR structure describes a color in a device independent way.

speaker: Apiza
text: Use al_map_rgb et al. and al_unmap_rgb et al. to translate from and to various color representations.

speaker: Programmer
text: What are the parameters for al_map_rgb?

speaker: Apiza
text: I am not sure about the coordinate system for x and y .

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the minimum and maximum value for x and y?

speaker: Apiza
text:
```ALLEGRO_COLOR al_map_rgb(
 unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b)```

speaker: Apiza
text: Convert r, g, b (ranging from 0-255) into an ALLEGRO_COLOR, using 255 for alpha.

speaker: Apiza
text: x and y refer to the pixel coordinates within the display. The coordinate (0,0) refers to the upper-left-most pixel of the display.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I get the height and width of the window?

speaker: Apiza
text: These methods should work:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```int al_get_display_width(ALLEGRO_DISPLAY *display)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Gets the width of the display.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```int al_get_display_height(ALLEGRO_DISPLAY *display)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Gets the height of the display.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I convert an integer from al_get_display_width to a float for coordinate x?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_get_display_width returns an int.

speaker: Apiza
text: This value can cast to a float

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the return type of al_draw_text?

speaker: Apiza
text: void al_draw_text\n\nVoid return

speaker: Programmer
text: Can you give me an example to render text?

speaker: Apiza
text: Sure,

speaker: Apiza
text: I will try to put together an example.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I stop a timer?

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I register mouse events?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_stop_timer should work:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```void al_stop_timer(ALLEGRO_TIMER *timer)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Stop the timer specified.

speaker: Apiza
text: I was able to put together an example to Render text:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```al_init_font_addon(); // initialize the font addon
al_init_ttf_addon();// initialize the ttf (True Type Font) addon
...
ALLEGRO_DISPLAY *display = al_create_display(640,480);
...
ALLEGRO_FONT *font = al_load_ttf_font("pirulen.ttf",72,0 );
...
al_draw_text(font, al_map_rgb(255,255,255), 640/2, (480/4),ALLEGRO_ALIGN_CENTRE, "Your Text Here!");```

speaker: Apiza
text: Does this look useful?

speaker: Apiza
text: There are several Mouse event types:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
ALLEGRO_EVENT_MOUSE_AXES
ALLEGRO_EVENT_MOUSE_BUTTON_DOWN
ALLEGRO_EVENT_MOUSE_BUTTON_UP
ALLEGRO_EVENT_MOUSE_WARPED
ALLEGRO_EVENT_MOUSE_ENTER_DISPLAY
ALLEGRO_EVENT_MOUSE_LEAVE_DISPLAY

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I get the state of a timer?

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I resume a timer after stopping it?

speaker: Apiza
text: I found a few methods to get information about an ALLEGRO_TIMER :\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
al_get_timer_started
al_get_timer_count
al_get_timer_speed
al_get_timer_event_source

speaker: Apiza
text: I could not find any that return an ALLEGRO_STATE .

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the return type of al_get_timer_started?

speaker: Apiza
text: ``` void al_resume_timer(ALLEGRO_TIMER *timer)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Resume the timer specified.

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_get_timer_started(const ALLEGRO_TIMER *timer)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Return true if the timer specified is currently started.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I install the mouse driver?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_install_mouse\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_install_mouse(void)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Install a mouse driver.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true if successful. If a driver was already installed, nothing happens and true is returned.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I load a bitmap?

speaker: Apiza
text: The simplest function is al_load_bitmap:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```ALLEGRO_BITMAP *al_load_bitmap(const char *filename)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Loads an image file into a new ALLEGRO_BITMAP.

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I scale and draw a bitmap?

speaker: Apiza
text: There are a few methods that fit:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
al_draw_scaled_rotated_bitmap
al_draw_tinted_scaled_rotated_bitmap
al_draw_tinted_scaled_rotated_bitmap_region
al_draw_scaled_bitmap
al_draw_tinted_scaled_bitmap

speaker: Apiza
text: The simplest method is al_draw_scaled_bitmap:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```void al_draw_scaled_bitmap(ALLEGRO_BITMAP *bitmap,
 float sx, float sy, float sw, float sh,
 float dx, float dy, float dw, float dh, int flags)```

speaker: Apiza
text: Draws a scaled version of the given bitmap to the target bitmap.

speaker: Programmer
text: What are the parameters sx, sy, sw, sh, etc.?

speaker: Apiza
text:
The parameters for al_draw_scaled_bitmap:

sx - source x
sy - source y
sw - source width
sh - source height
dx - destination x
dy - destination y
dw - destination width
dh - destination height
flags - same as for al_draw_bitmap

speaker: Programmer
text: What does al_set_target_bitmap do?

speaker: Apiza
text:
To summarize:

This function selects the bitmap to which all subsequent drawing operations in the calling thread will draw to.

speaker: Apiza
text: Would you like the full description?

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I draw a bitmap onto another bitmap?

speaker: Programmer
text: How can I get the width of a bitmap?

speaker: Apiza
text: All al_draw_* functions draw onto the target bitmap. The target bitmap defaults to the display, unless otherwise specified. The target bitmap can be set with al_set_target_bitmap.

speaker: Apiza
text: al_get_bitmap_width\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```int al_get_bitmap_width(ALLEGRO_BITMAP *bitmap)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns the width of a bitmap in pixels.

speaker: Programmer
text: Do I need to initialize bitmap before calling al_load_bitmap?

speaker: Apiza
text: I do not think so.

speaker: Apiza
text: I found the following example in which al_load_bitmap without al_create_bitmap:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
ALLEGRO_BITMAP *image = NULL;

...

al_init_image_addon()

...

image = al_load_bitmap("image.png");```
